title: 2024 Incident Scenerios
content:
Assignment: 2024 Incident Scenerios

Points: 100.0
Submission Types: online_upload

Description:
Cloud StorageScenario:One of your organization’s internal departments frequently uses outside cloud storage to store large amounts of data, some of which may be sensitive. You have recently learned that the cloud storage provider being used has been publicly compromised and large amounts of data have been exposed. All user passwords and data in the cloud provider’s infrastructure may have been compromised.How do you respond?
Items to discuss with your group:
Containment

What strategy should the organization take to contain the incident? Why is this strategy preferable to others?

What could happen if the incident were not contained?

What additional tools and organizations might be needed to respond to this particular incident?

Post-Incident Activities

What could be done to prevent similar incidents from occurring in the future?

What could be done to improve detection of similar incidents?

What could be done to improve containment of similar incidents?

Be prepared to discuss in class (Elevator Pitch style):

Your strategy to contain the attack.

What additional tools and resources you would need.

What your group learned.

PII AccidentScenario:You receive news that one of your employees has accidentally disclosed sensitive personally identifiable information (PII) for over 200 clients and personnel. This occurred when they emailed a document that had not been properly scrubbed to a contractor. The employee had been recently trained on PII handling.How do you respond?
Items to discuss with your group:
Containment

What strategy should the organization take to contain the incident?

Why is this strategy preferable to others?

What could happen if the incident were not contained?

What additional tools and organizations might be needed?

Post-Incident Activities

How to prevent similar incidents in the future?

How to improve detection of similar incidents?

How to improve containment for similar incidents?

Be prepared to discuss in class (Elevator Pitch style):

Your strategy to contain the attack.

Tools/resources needed.

What your group learned.

Social MediaScenario:Your organization’s social media website is compromised. A terrorist group calling themselves “Rebellion Cyber Forces” has claimed responsibility for attacks against government organizations. They have gained control of your organization’s official social media account and are sending public notifications claiming your organization has been compromised.How do you respond?
Items to discuss with your group:
Containment

Strategy to contain the incident and why.

What happens if the incident isn't contained?

Additional tools/organizations needed?

Post-Incident Activities

How to prevent similar incidents?

How to improve detection?

How to improve containment?

Be prepared to discuss in class (Elevator Pitch style):

Your strategy to contain the attack.

Tools/resources needed.

What your group learned.

Zero-DayScenario:The browser deployed on all organizational workstations has a significant zero-day vulnerability being actively exploited. Ten workstations are already compromised and help desk calls are spiking. No patch or workaround exists yet; a patch is expected in one week.How do you respond?
Items to discuss with your group:
Containment

Recommended containment strategy and why.

Risks if not contained.

Additional tools/organizations needed?

Post-Incident Activities

Prevention of similar incidents.

Improved detection.

Improved containment.

Be prepared to discuss in class (Elevator Pitch style):

Containment strategy.

Tools/resources required.

What your group learned.
